page.title: 16Schools. 1
page.content: {Primary Schools.}Friars Grove,which opened in 1966, has 200 children, aged 7-11, and 8 staff.An infant school is on the same site. Roach Vale opened in 1977 and now has 206 children, aged from 4-11, and 11 teachers. The uniform is red and grey. St. Anne's was built in 1939. In this school there are 13 teachers and 254 chlidren, aged between 3 and 11 years. Parsons Heath was opened in 1889. The present building dates from 1966 and now has 208 pupils and 7 teachers. St. Thomas More's was opened in 1860 and now has 157 children. Hazelmere opened in 1967 with about 200 pupils and 7 teachers. An infant school is on the same site.St. James' was opened in 1961 and has 250 children, aged from 5-11 years. St. John's first opened in 1863 with about 30 children. The present building dates from 1971.
